pageTitle: Convert user account e-mail templates to configuration system [#1757566] | Drupal.org
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {176306=(Related to the test standard question: #1869794: Update tests coding standards doc and make consistant with 1354 where appropriate.), 65096=@sun: re the long lines - I generated the YAML file using the now removed _user_mail_text() function... so this what the current Symfony YAML component will do. Going to investigate an upstream patch to allow mutli-line strings to be dumped using the literal style shown here http://michael.f1337.us/2010/03/30/482836205/ - which Symfony's YAML parser already understands.}

textAfterTable: Log in or register to post comments Comment #2 alexpott CreditAttribution: alexpott commented August 27, 2012 at 6:51am Status: Active » Needs review Status File Size new 1757566_2.user_mails.drupal8.patch 24.67 KB PASSED: [[SimpleTest]]: [MySQL] 40,706 pass(es). [ View ] I started work on this at the DrupalConMunich sprint. Not sure that this is a complete novice task as the install is a bit tricky since we can't use update_variables_to_config() as the user mail variable may or may not exist it the variable table. Anyhow :) here's the patch. Log in or register to post comments
